summary_reasoning: The report’s key valuation and forecast assumptions are largely explicit and proximal to the model: WACC/COE, terminal growth, revenue CAGR (with segment splits), operating margin trajectory, capex path, and share buybacks are stated with magnitudes and horizons. Specificity is solid (percentages, dollar amounts, 2025–2029 timelines, and causal drivers like AI capacity and operating leverage). Justification is partial: several inputs reference external sources (GuruFocus for WACC, Morningstar/Reuters for growth/capex), and history is cited for margins; however, others (terminal growth at 4%, Services 8% CAGR, Cloud 25%+) rely on broad rationale without thorough benchmarking or segment detail. Internal consistency has a notable contradiction: 2025 capex is “reaffirmed $75 billion” in the Analyst Note, while the model and capital allocation assume ~$85 billion and “peaking at $85 billion in 2025,” with no reconciliation. Critically, there is no quantified sensitivity/scenario analysis for material levers (revenue growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth, capex, buybacks), which triggers the hard cap at Fair. Overall, assumptions are explicit and specific but only partially justified, with one unresolved numeric inconsistency and no stress-testing.

assumptions_extracted.quote: weighted average cost of capital around 9%
We project a 5-year revenue CAGR of ~10%
Operating margin is forecast to expand to ~34–35% by 2029
We model annual capital expenditures peaking at $85 billion in 2025 (21% of revenue) then moderating to ~15% of revenue by 2029
Our share count assumptions incorporate ~$50–70 billion of buybacks per year, reducing shares outstanding by ~2% annually.
Google Services revenue growing ~8% annually and Google Cloud ~25%+
Our DCF model assumes a 9.5% cost of equity

contradictions.description: 2025 capex stated as “reaffirmed $75 billion” but modeled/assumed as ~$85 billion and “peaking at $85 billion in 2025.”

unjustified_parameters: Google Services ~8% and Cloud ~25%+ growth without detailed peer/segment benchmarking
cost of equity 9.5% without decomposition (risk-free, beta)
